description: From Middle French superscription, or its source, Late Latin superscriptio, from superscribere.

entries.meaning: Something written (or engraved) on the surface, outside, or above something else; specifically, an address on a letter, envelope, etc.
examples: Its superscription was my name, and the name of the sender, my mother.

entries.meaning: An editorial addition at the beginning, often indicating the authorship of a piece.
examples: By a pure error, or perhaps through a confusion in the traditions, Achish the Philistine (of Gath, 1 Sam. xxi., xxvii.), to whom David fled, is called Abimelech in the superscription to Psalm 34.
